title: Landslide in Sudan's Darfur Kills 1,000; Sole Survivor Found
snippets: Up to 1,000 dead after a landslide levels a village in western Sudan, as displaced residents flee famine and war.
The landslide wiped out an entire village in the Marra Mountains, according to the Sudan Liberation Movement/Army. Only one person is said to have survived.

Landslide destroyed a village in the Marra mountains area of western Sudan and left only one survivor

More than 1,000 people were killed in a landslide in western Sudan on Sunday, according to a rebel group that controls the area.

The landslide, which followed heavy rain, destroyed th
A landslide in a remote area of Darfur destroyed an entire village, a rebel group holding the territory said. Heavy rains are hampering rescue efforts.
The landslide leveled a village in the remote Marra mountains, a local rebel group said. Its leader appealed for urgent help, saying, “This is a nightmare.”
titles: As many as 1,000 killed in Sudan landslide
Sudan landslide kills over 1,000 people, says rebel group
Sudan landslide kills at least 1,000 people, rebel group says
Sudan landslide kills hundreds, U.N. says; rebel group says one survivor remains
Landslide Kills Hundreds in Sudan
summary: A landslide in Sudan's Darfur region, caused by heavy rain, destroyed a village in the Marra Mountains, leaving over 1,000 people dead with only one survivor. The Sudan Liberation Movement/Army, which controls the area, has called for international assistance to recover bodies.

title: Toronto Maple Leafs Extend Goalie Dennis Hildeby for 3 Years
snippets: The Toronto Maple Leafs have signed goaltender Dennis Hildeby to a three-year contract extension, the team announced Tuesday.
Maple Leafs Sign Goaltender Dennis Hildeby&n
Toronto Maple Leafs goalie Dennis Hildeby agreed to a three-year, $2.525 million contract extension, the team announced on Tuesday.
titles: Leafs sign goalie Hildeby to three-year extension
Maple Leafs Sign Goaltender Dennis Hildeby - NHL.com
Maple Leafs sign goalie Dennis Hildeby to three-year contract extension
summary: The Toronto Maple Leafs have signed goaltender Dennis Hildeby to a three-year contract extension, the team announced Tuesday.

title: Judge Rules Trump's National Guard Deployment in LA Illegal
snippets: President Trump took control of the state's National Guard in June and deployed it to Los Angeles to face anti-immigration protestors and assist officers making detentions and deportations.
US District Judge Charles Breyer questioned Trump's rationale that the Los Angeles protests constituted a 'rebellion'.
Ruling says government violated law banning US military from enforcing domestic law
titles: A California judge rules that Trump's deployment of the guard to LA was illegal
US judge declares Trump’s military deployment to Los Angeles illegal
Judge blocks Trump’s deployment of National Guard in California
summary: In June, President Trump deployed the state's National Guard to Los Angeles to address anti-immigration protests and support detainment and deportation efforts. US District Judge Charles Breyer ruled this action illegal, stating it violated laws preventing US military from engaging in domestic law enforcement. Breyer challenged Trump's classification of the protests as a 'rebellion.'

title: Gérard Depardieu to Stand Trial for 2018 Rape Charges
snippets: The French film star is accused of raping and sexually assaulting actor Charlotte Arnould in 2018.
The actress Charlotte Arnould has accused the French movie icon of raping her twice in 2018 at his home in Paris. He denies wrongdoing.

Judge orders case to be heard against French film star after allegations made by Charlotte Arnould about 2018 incidents

The French actor Gérard Depardieu has been ordered to stand trial on charges of raping and sexually assault

PARIS (AP) — The French film star Gérard Depardieu has been ordered to stand trial before a criminal court in Paris over allegations of rape and sexual assault against actor Charlotte Arnould. “I feel relieved,” Arnould, 29, wrote on Instagram on Tuesday, announcing that she had received the investi
titles: Gerard Depardieu ordered to stand trial for rape — lawyer
Gérard Depardieu Is Ordered to Stand Trial Over Rape Accusations
Depardieu to stand trial over alleged rape and sexual assault of fellow actor
Gérard Depardieu to face trial in Paris over rape and sexual assault allegations
summary: French actor Gérard Depardieu has been ordered to stand trial on charges of raping and sexually assaulting Charlotte Arnould in 2018 at his Paris home. Arnould, who has publicly accused Depardieu of raping her twice, expressed relief at the decision. Depardieu denies any wrongdoing.

title: Will Power Leaves Team Penske After 17 Seasons, Ending Historic Partnership
snippets: Ending a year of speculation, it was announced Tuesday that Will Power would not be returning to Team Penske for an 18th season.
One of the most successful relationships in IndyCar history has ended as Team Penske and 2-time IndyCar Champion and 2018 Indianapolis 500 winner Will Power have split.
Will Power, the consummate company man who won two IndyCar titles and the Indianapolis 500 for Roger Penske, will not return to Team Penske for an 18th season.
titles: Two-time IndyCar champ Power out at Penske
After 17 Seasons Team Penske Will Not Re-Sign IndyCar Great Will Power
Will Power won’t return to Team Penske will not return for 18th season
summary: Will Power, a two-time IndyCar Champion and 2018 Indianapolis 500 winner, will not return to Team Penske for an 18th season, ending one of the most successful partnerships in IndyCar history. This decision concludes a year of speculation about Power's future with the team.

title: Padres' Jason Adam Injured, Carted Off Field in Game vs Orioles
snippets: All-Star reliever Jason Adam was carted off the field after getting injured in the seventh inning of the Padres' loss to the Orioles on Monday.
San Diego loses a key high-leverage reliever with the playoffs approaching
All-Star reliever Jason Adam of the San Diego Padres was carted off the field after getting injured in the seventh inning Monday against the Baltimore Orioles.

Jason Adam injury: Padres All-Star RP suffers ruptured quad in loss to Orioles, reveals recovery timeline

title: Kraft Heinz to Split into Two Public Companies, Confirming Speculations
snippets: Split will undo 2015 tie-up orchestrated by Warren Buffett and investment group 3G Capital

Chicago-based food group says it will split into two publicly traded companies through tax-free spin-off

  • Business live – latest
Ten years after Warren Buffett backed the merger of Kraft Foods and Heinz, the combined company is breaking up, as Kraft Heinz Co. on Tuesday confirmed what Wall Street has expected for months.
titles: Kraft Heinz announces break-up a decade after megamerger
Kraft Heinz to split a decade after merger in bid to revive growth
Big Warren Buffett–backed merger calls it quits as Kraft Heinz announces breakup
summary: Kraft Heinz Co., formed by a merger in 2015 supported by Warren Buffett and 3G Capital, announced it will split into two separate publicly traded companies through a tax-free spin-off. This move comes ten years after the original merger, confirming recent Wall Street expectations.

title: Bolsonaro Faces 40-Year Sentence in Coup Plot Trial
snippets: Prosecutors in Jair Bolsonaro's coup-plotting trial deliver closing arguments this week, with the former Brazilian president facing a possible 40-year sentence.
The former president is charged with five counts, including plotting the assassination of senior officials.
Former Brazilian president in court along with seven others accused of failed power grab after 2022 election loss.
The former Brazilian president is charged with planning a coup after losing the 2022 elections. He says he pursued only legal avenues to remain in power. Here is what to know about the trial.
titles: Brazil's ex-President Bolsonaro coup trial begins — here's what to know
Trial of Brazil’s Bolsonaro enters verdict phase over alleged coup plot
Why is Brazil’s Jair Bolsonaro on trial — and what’s next?
What to Know About Jair Bolsonaro’s Coup Plot Trial
summary: Prosecutors delivered closing arguments in the trial of former Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro, who faces a potential 40-year sentence for plotting a coup after his 2022 election loss. Charged with five counts, including planning the assassination of senior officials, Bolsonaro is on trial alongside seven others for attempting a failed power grab. Bolsonaro maintains he sought only legal means to stay in power.

title: Houston Man Charged in Fatal Shooting of Boy in Prank Incident
snippets: A man has been charged with murder in the shooting of a Houston boy who police said was playing a door-knocking prank on a neighbor's home.

Leon Gonzalo Jr, 42, was arrested and charged with murder in connection with the Houston shooting

A 42-year-old man in Texas has been charged with murder after the fatal shooting of an 11-year-
Houston police said the victim and his friends were playing a game of 'ding dong ditch,' when someone rings a doorbell and then runs away.

Texas man charged after 11-year-old boy shot dead while playing doorbell prank
11-year-old boy shot, killed during ‘ding dong ditch’ prank, man charged with murder
summary: A 42-year-old man, Leon Gonzalo Jr, has been charged with murder following the fatal shooting of an 11-year-old boy in Houston. The incident occurred while the boy and his friends were engaged in a "ding dong ditch" prank.

title: UK Carmaker Hit by Cyberattack, Staff Sent Home, No Customer Data Breached
snippets: Staff were sent home and the company shut down its IT systems in an effort to minimise the damage done.

Carmaker says it has shut down its systems but there is no evidence customer data has been stolen

  • Business live – latest updates
titles: Jaguar Land Rover production severely hit by cyber-attack
Jaguar Land Rover says production ‘severely’ disrupted by cyber incident
Jaguar Land Rover manufacturing and retail ‘severely disrupted’ by cyber incident
summary: A UK carmaker experienced a cybersecurity incident, leading to staff being sent home and the shutdown of its IT systems to limit damage. Despite these measures, the company has found no evidence that customer data was compromised.

title: Federal Judge Rules National Guard's ICE Raid Involvement in LA Illegal
snippets: National Guard illegally performed law enforcement in LA, judge rules&nbs
The ruling from Judge Charles Breyer in San Francisco federal court comes as Trump mulls deploying National Guard troops to other cities to deal with crime.

Judge said administration violated federal law by sending troops to accompany Ice agents on immigration raids

  • US politics li
titles: National Guard illegally performed law enforcement in LA, judge rules - Axios
Trump can’t use National Guard, military in California to enforce laws, Judge Breyer rules
Trump illegally deployed national guard during LA Ice protests, judge rules
summary: A federal judge in San Francisco, Charles Breyer, ruled that the National Guard's involvement in law enforcement activities in Los Angeles, specifically accompanying ICE agents on immigration raids, was illegal under federal law. This decision comes amid considerations by the Trump administration to deploy National Guard troops to various cities to address crime.

title: Massive Earthquake Hits Afghanistan, Death Toll Rises
snippets: Rescuers are hampered by mountainous terrain and roads strewn with debris.
Families are searching for loved ones under the rubble in eastern Afghanistan after a magnitude 6 quake wiped villages.
As the death toll climbs past 1,400, rescue workers are trying to reach survivors in the isolated regions of Afghanistan that were ravaged by a massive earthquake.
titles: Aerial search for survivors after Afghan quake kills 800 people
Families search for survivors under rubble after Afghan earthquake
Afghanistan earthquake: Search on for survivors in remote areas
summary: A massive earthquake has devastated isolated regions in Afghanistan, leading to an increasing death toll. Ehsanullah Ehsan, the provincial head of disaster management, stated that the number of bodies trapped cannot be predicted. Rescue workers are currently trying to reach survivors amidst the destruction.

title: Nestlé Fires CEO Freixe Over Conduct, Names Navratil New Chief
snippets: <a href="https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMiiwFBVV95cUxNZjZYNnVqb25tcGUzeTZkeHN3REFlckdRVUhNUW9uQldPUWo0Nms2cGJ0TmdXdmtxWFk2NThQSGZxSmRLaWtKcnpmQUozdS1tR2tJUmZTUUJOYlR5MnM1clZNc2lRQVVHYkd2ZUhITExLV0VvN2N5T1JfOWhLRjBuN0ZQZ2dRQ203MDRB?oc=5" target="_blank">Nestlé fires CEO Laurent Freixe over "r

Swiss multinational finds Laurent Freixe breached code of conduct as it names Philipp Navratil as his replacement

Nestlé has dismissed its chief executive, Laurent Freixe, after an investigation into an “undisclosed romantic relationship” with a subordinate that was found to have breached i
The Swiss food giant said Laurent Freixe’s dismissal was effective immediately and named longtime executive Philipp Navratil as its new CEO.
titles: Nestlé fires CEO Laurent Freixe over "romantic relationship" with employee - Axios
Nestlé sacks CEO over ‘undisclosed romantic relationship’
Nestlé removes CEO after investigation into relationship with subordinate
summary: Nestlé dismissed CEO Laurent Freixe for failing to disclose a romantic relationship with a direct subordinate, breaching the company's code of conduct. Philipp Navratil, previously of Nestlé Nespresso, was appointed as the new CEO, marking the company's third chief executive change in just over a year.

title: Company to Launch Teen Mental Health Feature Amid Lawsuit
snippets: L’option arrivera dans le courant du mois, affirme l’entreprise, et devrait permettre de surveiller la santé psychologique des adolescents. L’annonce survient alors qu’un couple d’Américains a porté plainte contre OpenAI après le suicide de leur fils.
Promised protections follow reports of vulnerable users misled in extended chats.
titles: OpenAI va instaurer un contrôle parental sur ChatGPT
OpenAI announces parental controls for ChatGPT after teen suicide lawsuit
summary: An upcoming feature aimed at monitoring the mental health of teenagers will be launched by a company within the month. This announcement comes after a lawsuit was filed by a U.S. couple against OpenAI, blaming the firm for their son's suicide. The initiative seeks to address concerns about the safety of vulnerable users in extended chats.

title: Judge Rules Trump's Troop Deployment in LA Unlawful, Limits Future Actions
snippets: The Trump administration's use of federal troops in Los Angeles to conduct law enforcement operations is unlawful, a federal judge ruled on Tuesday.
The decision could limit Trump’s ability to send the National Guard to other cities, as he threatens to send troops to Chicago.
titles: Use of federal troops in Los Angeles is unlawful, judge says
Trump’s Los Angeles Takeover Violated Federal Law, Judge Rules
summary: A federal judge ruled on Tuesday that the Trump administration's deployment of federal troops for law enforcement operations in Los Angeles is unlawful. This decision may restrict Trump's capacity to deploy the National Guard to cities like Chicago, as he has threatened.

title: Klarna Files for U.S. IPO, Seeks Up to $1.27B, Valuation at $14B
snippets: Swedish fintech firm Klarna is aiming to raise up to $1.27 billion in its long-awaited U.S. initial public offering, according to its official filing on Tuesday.

Swedish buy now, pay later (BNPL) startup Klarna and its shareholders are reviving its initial public offering, hoping to raise as much as $1.27 billion in a listing that would value the company at up to $14 billion.
titles: Klarna aims to raise up to $1.27 billion in U.S. IPO
Klarna revives IPO plans, aims to raise $1.27B
summary: Swedish fintech company Klarna, specializing in buy now, pay later services, has officially filed for a U.S. initial public offering (IPO) with the aim of raising up to $1.27 billion. This move could value Klarna at up to $14 billion.

title: Labor Day Sales Offer Big Discounts on TVs, School Supplies Ahead of Sports Seas
snippets: Labor Day weekend is over, which means the symbolic end of summer has passed. On a more positive note, dozens of the best Labor Day deals are still around, so you still have time to take advantage of them if you spent the long weekend offline. For a limited time, you can save on a […]

summary: Labor Day weekend, marking the unofficial end of summer, brings a wave of sales on a wide range of products, including big-screen OLED TVs and back-to-school essentials. Coinciding with the lead-up to major sports events, such as the 2025-2026 NFL season, World Cup qualifiers, and MLB post-season games, the holiday offers extensive discounts. Comprehensive guides have been compiled to help shoppers navigate nearly 100 deals considered worth the investment.
